headline.main: Why Does Terror Rear Its Head?

lead_paragraph: To the Editor: Edward Rothstein (''Exploring the Flaws in the Notion of the 'Root Causes' of Terror,'' Arts & Ideas pages, Nov. 17) suggests that poverty and injustice cannot be considered among the root causes of Islamic terrorism because Osama bin Laden is a multimillionaire. By that logic, slavery could not have caused the Civil War because Abraham Lincoln was not a slave. COREY ROBIN Brooklyn, Nov. 17, 2001 The writer is an assistant professor of political science at Brooklyn College, CUNY.
abstract: Letter from Corey Robin rejects Edward Rothstein's logic in denying that poverty and injustice could be among root causes of terrorism (Nov 17 column)
